title: Social Data Analysis Through Proportional Reasoning and Early Algebraic Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic computation skills and experience interpreting data tables/graphs
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning structure utilizing LMS in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment; performance of real-life-connected projects using social sector data

learning_goals: Social phenomenon data involving proportional relationships can be converted and analyzed through various tables/graphs
The proportional reasoning process can be generalized and explained through mathematical expressions/symbolic representations.
Learners can propose decision-making strategies applying proportional-algebraic reasoning in social problem-solving projects.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
